text: Pema Khandu (born 21 August 1979) is an Indian politician and the Chief Minister of Arunachal Pradesh. He is the son of former Chief Minister Dorjee Khandu. He became Chief Minister in July 2016. Since then, he and his government changed political parties twice—first from the Indian National Congress to the Peoples Party of Arunachal in September, and then to the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) in December 2016. Earlier, he was the Minister of Tourism, Urban Development, and Water Resources in Nabam Tuki’s government. == References == Category:Living people Category:Articles with permanently dead links to other websites Category:Articles with dead links to other websites from December 2024 Category:All articles with dead links to other websites Category:Pages with unreviewed translations Category:1979 births Category:Bharatiya Janata Party politicians Category:People from Arunachal Pradesh
title: Pema Khandu
